compliant.legal provisions: Lawfulness of processing: processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is party or in order to take steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract; legitimate interests.
Lawfulness of processing: processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject; legitimate interests.

compliant.section: 四、如何存取和控制您的個人資料
compliant.legal provisions: Right of access by the data subject; Right to rectification; Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten'); Right to restriction of processing; Right to data portability; Right to object; Automated individual decision-making, including profiling.

compliant.section: 五、處理個人資料的合法基礎
compliant.legal provisions: Lawfulness of processing: The data controller shall process personal data only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies.

compliant.section: 六、我們對於您個人資料的保存期間
compliant.legal provisions: Principles relating to processing of personal data: storage limitation.

compliant.section: 七、您的資料與其他國家
compliant.legal provisions: Transfers of personal data to third countries or international organisations.
Chapter III: Rights of the data subject.
Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject; Information to be provided where personal data have not been obtained from the data subject.

non_compliant.legal provisions: Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject; Information to be provided where personal data have not been obtained from the data subject.
non_compliant.amend: This section should clearly state the specific purposes for which each category of personal data is collected, as well as the legal basis for processing. It should also specify the types of personal data collected for each purpose, both directly and indirectly. For data collected indirectly, the categories of data and the source should be specified. Additionally, it should be clarified whether the provision of personal data is a statutory or contractual requirement, or a requirement necessary to enter into a contract, as well as the possible consequences of failure to provide such data.

This section lacks specific details about the technical and organisational security measures implemented to protect personal data. It should describe the measures taken to ensure confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of processing systems and services. Examples of such measures include encryption, pseudonymization, access control, data backup and disaster recovery plans. The section should also mention the process for regularly testing, assessing and evaluating the effectiveness of these measures.
